hero.title: About Math Library
hero.subtitle: Understanding our mission, values, and approach to mathematics education.

items: Preserve mathematical knowledge for future generations
Make high-quality mathematics education freely accessible
Promote clarity and rigor in mathematical exposition
Build a community of mathematicians, educators, and learners
Demonstrate that mathematical knowledge can be shared sustainably

articles.title: Accessibility
articles.content: Mathematics belongs to everyone. We're committed to making our resources free and available to all, regardless of geography or resources.

articles.title: Rigor
articles.content: Mathematical truth requires precision and care. We maintain high standards for accuracy, clarity of definitions, and soundness of proofs.

articles.title: Preservation
articles.content: Knowledge should be preserved for future generations. We build with sustainable practices and standards that will endure.

articles.title: Community
articles.content: The best learning happens together. We invite contributions, welcome discussion, and celebrate collaborative knowledge building.

articles.title: Clarity
articles.content: Mathematics should be understandable. We write for clarity without sacrificing rigor, making complex ideas accessible.

articles.title: Content Over Presentation
articles.content: We prioritize clear, rigorous content over flashy design. The design serves the content, not the other way around.

articles.title: Depth Over Breadth
articles.content: We focus on deep understanding of core topics rather than superficial coverage. Better to know a few things well than many things poorly.

articles.title: Preservation Over Trends
articles.content: Built for permanence, not for today's fashion. Our website uses semantic HTML and web standards that will remain relevant for decades.

articles.title: Open Over Commercial
articles.content: No paywalls, no algorithms, no advertising. Math Library is a public resource, maintained for the benefit of all.

content.text: Math Library is built by a community of contributors. If you've contributed content, feedback, or ideas, thank you for helping build this resource.

Math Library was founded on the belief that mathematical knowledge should be organized, preserved, and shared freely. We're inspired by the great universities, public libraries, and open knowledge projects that came before us.
